case_address_found_1: Approx. 6 miles South of MS Coast Coliseum
case_circumstances: On September 3, 2007, a boater found a male body floating in the Gulf of Mexico about 6 miles south of the Mississippi Coast Coliseum in Harrison County, MS.  Autopsy revealed the remains were a white male, 50-70 years of age, approximately 6 feet tall, 185 pounds, with balding gray hair and a beard, missing three front teeth.
case_head_hair: Bald on top but had approximately 4" long gray hair around the back/sides of head
case_body_hair: Gray hair on legs approximately 1" in length.  Sparse hair on forearms.
case_facial_hair: Gray and white whiskers on the face about 1/2" in length.  Whiskers extend onto the neck where they are black and gray 1/2"- 3/4" in length.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_on_body: Blue or Black "Class Club" brand shorts, size 20.  Based on the brand and size we believe those were boys, not mens, shorts.  No other clothing on body.
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
